text:
Sales divisions use Salesforce to manage
their customers, manage the sales, leads,

and then they use the platform
to build out their sales processes.
So if Salesforce tried to rebuild everything or
build our own, focus on just our own generative models,

then we'd be missing out on our customers
that already have their data on AWS.

And my team is actually the one that's
building that unified model management
where we can manage the models

that you've built directly on top of
Data Cloud, as well as the models

that you brought in from SageMaker and
other AI tools to then power every

single experience within your
application with a little bit of AI.

AWS has a really great ML platform,
SageMaker. And now with Bedrock

and some of these generative models,
our customers can get that right away.

And then they have more control
over kind of how all their AI strategy works.

The Salesforce experience should be
managed fully within that sort of platform.
We're calling it now the Einstein One platform.

And you should be able to build
those intelligent experiences with point

and click, and not have to worry about
an integration directly within the app.
The integration should be within the platform,

and then you can seamlessly
use that across all of your apps.
